intro: Lastrea calcarata var. sericea, commonly known as the silky rockrose, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its fleshy, spiny stems and small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The leaves are typically small and covered in a fine, silky hair, giving the plant its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. This plant is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
